events.name: Suicide Bombing at Political Convention in Pakistan
events.wd_label: Suicide Bombing at Political Convention in Pakistan
events.wd_description: A suicide bomber attacked a political convention organized by the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazi (JUI-F) party in northwestern Pakistan, resulting in at least 54 deaths and over 100 injuries.
events.description: A suicide bomber attacked a political convention organized by the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazi (JUI-F) party in northwestern Pakistan, resulting in at least 54 deaths and over 100 injuries.

events.name: Attack Details
events.wd_description: The suicide bombing targeted the JUI-F party members during a political convention with over 500 attendees, causing significant casualties.
events.description: The suicide bombing targeted the JUI-F party members during a political convention with over 500 attendees, causing significant casualties.

events.name: Suspected Perpetrators
events.wd_description: No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but the local branch of ISIS has previously targeted JUI-F party leaders, considering them apostates.
events.description: No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but the local branch of ISIS has previously targeted JUI-F party leaders, considering them apostates.

events.name: Reactions and Condemnations
events.wd_description: The attack was condemned by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and JUI-F party leader Maulana Fazlur, who expressed deep sorrow over the blast.
events.description: The attack was condemned by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and JUI-F party leader Maulana Fazlur, who expressed deep sorrow over the blast.

events.name: Investigation Launch
events.wd_description: An investigation into the blast has been launched, with the Prime Minister's office requesting a report from the Minister for Interior, Arabs Sanaullah, and the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government.
events.description: An investigation into the blast has been launched, with the Prime Minister's office requesting a report from the Minister for Interior, Arabs Sanaullah, and the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government.

events.name: Military Coup in Niger
events.wd_description: Military personnel in Niger have removed President Mohamed Bazoum from power, citing a deteriorating security situation and bad governance.
events.description: Military personnel in Niger have removed President Mohamed Bazoum from power, citing a deteriorating security situation and bad governance.

events.name: Coup Announcement
events.wd_description: A group of soldiers appeared on national television to announce the removal of President Mohamed Bazoum from power.
events.description: A group of soldiers appeared on national television to announce the removal of President Mohamed Bazoum from power.

events.name: Detainment of President Bazoum
events.wd_description: Armed troops blocked the presidential palace in Niamey and detained President Mohamed Bazoum.
events.description: Armed troops blocked the presidential palace in Niamey and detained President Mohamed Bazoum.

events.name: National Curfew and Border Closure
events.wd_description: Following the coup, a national curfew was announced, the country’s borders were closed, and all institutions of the republic were suspended.
events.description: Following the coup, a national curfew was announced, the country’s borders were closed, and all institutions of the republic were suspended.

events.name: U.S. Response
events.wd_description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken expressed support for President Bazoum as the democratically elected leader and called for his immediate release.
events.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken expressed support for President Bazoum as the democratically elected leader and called for his immediate release.

events.name: Imran Khan Sentenced to Prison
events.wd_description: Former Prime Minister of Pakistan, Imran Khan, has been sentenced to three years in prison over corruption allegations related to undeclared earnings from selling gifts received while in office.
events.description: Former Prime Minister of Pakistan, Imran Khan, has been sentenced to three years in prison over corruption allegations related to undeclared earnings from selling gifts received while in office.

events.name: Court Ruling
events.wd_description: Judge Humayun Dilawar found Imran Khan guilty of dishonesty, stating that his corruption was established beyond doubt.
events.description: Judge Humayun Dilawar found Imran Khan guilty of dishonesty, stating that his corruption was established beyond doubt.

events.name: Immediate Arrest Order
events.wd_description: The judge instructed the police to immediately arrest Imran Khan following the court ruling.
events.description: The judge instructed the police to immediately arrest Imran Khan following the court ruling.

events.name: Defense's Response
events.wd_description: Imran Khan’s lawyer, Intazar Hussain Panjutha, condemned the trial, claiming that Khan was not allowed to defend himself properly.
events.description: Imran Khan’s lawyer, Intazar Hussain Panjutha, condemned the trial, claiming that Khan was not allowed to defend himself properly.

events.name: Advancements in EV Battery Technologies
events.wd_description: The development of electric vehicle (EV) batteries is driven by advancements in various components, including cathodes, anodes, and emerging technologies such as solid-state and sodium-ion batteries.
events.description: The development of electric vehicle (EV) batteries is driven by advancements in various components, including cathodes, anodes, and emerging technologies such as solid-state and sodium-ion batteries.

events.name: Cathode Advancements
events.wd_description: Improvements in the energy density of EV batteries have been driven by advancements in cathodes over the past decade, particularly the shift towards chemistries with higher nickel content and lower cobalt content.
events.description: Improvements in the energy density of EV batteries have been driven by advancements in cathodes over the past decade, particularly the shift towards chemistries with higher nickel content and lower cobalt content.

events.name: Emerging Anode Technologies
events.wd_description: Next-generation anode technologies, including those based on silicon, lithium, and hard carbon, are expected to enter the battery market this decade, potentially displacing a significant portion of graphite demand.
events.description: Next-generation anode technologies, including those based on silicon, lithium, and hard carbon, are expected to enter the battery market this decade, potentially displacing a significant portion of graphite demand.

events.name: t: Silicon-Based Anodes
events.wd_description: Silicon-based anode materials offer high specific capacity but face challenges such as volumetric changes during cycling, which are being addressed through various techniques.
events.description: Silicon-based anode materials offer high specific capacity but face challenges such as volumetric changes during cycling, which are being addressed through various techniques.

events.name: t: Lithium-Metal Anodes
events.wd_description: Lithium-metal anodes, which require advanced electrolytes, have higher theoretical specific capacity than silicon-based anodes and graphite, potentially accounting for 22% of the anode chemistry mix for EVs by 2035.
events.description: Lithium-metal anodes, which require advanced electrolytes, have higher theoretical specific capacity than silicon-based anodes and graphite, potentially accounting for 22% of the anode chemistry mix for EVs by 2035.

events.name: Solid-State Batteries
events.wd_description: Solid-state batteries, which use solid electrolytes instead of liquid ones, are expected to offer longer ranges and faster charging capabilities at potentially lower costs.
events.description: Solid-state batteries, which use solid electrolytes instead of liquid ones, are expected to offer longer ranges and faster charging capabilities at potentially lower costs.

events.name: Sodium-Ion Batteries
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries are emerging as a potential alternative to lithium-ion batteries, with the potential to account for 3% of passenger car battery demand and 30% of battery demand in the two- and three-wheeler segment by 2035.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries are emerging as a potential alternative to lithium-ion batteries, with the potential to account for 3% of passenger car battery demand and 30% of battery demand in the two- and three-wheeler segment by 2035.

events.name: t: Lithium Displacement
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries could displace up to 7% of lithium demand by 2035, with a more aggressive scenario potentially displacing 37% of lithium demand.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries could displace up to 7% of lithium demand by 2035, with a more aggressive scenario potentially displacing 37% of lithium demand.

events.name: t: Supply Chain Expansion
events.wd_description: The widespread adoption of sodium-ion batteries would require a rapid expansion of the supply chain and manufacturing capabilities.
events.description: The widespread adoption of sodium-ion batteries would require a rapid expansion of the supply chain and manufacturing capabilities.

events.name: Impact on Raw Material Demand
events.wd_description: The adoption of new battery technologies is expected to significantly impact the demand for key raw materials such as lithium and graphite.
events.description: The adoption of new battery technologies is expected to significantly impact the demand for key raw materials such as lithium and graphite.

events.name: Graphite Demand Reduction
events.wd_description: Emerging anode technologies could displace up to 46% of graphite demand by 2035.
events.description: Emerging anode technologies could displace up to 46% of graphite demand by 2035.

events.name: Increased Lithium Demand
events.wd_description: The use of lithium-metal anodes and other advanced technologies will increase the overall demand for lithium, contributing to potential supply challenges.
events.description: The use of lithium-metal anodes and other advanced technologies will increase the overall demand for lithium, contributing to potential supply challenges.
